content:
Who is behind this website https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib-manual/html-multi/Tactics/Coersions/ ?

I'd like to tell them that "Coersions" is spelt "Coercions".
"spelt" is spelled "spelled" :wink: (it's @Jon Eugster)
You can also open a PR to https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib-manual/blob/e83c80eb5ba3478594887add2f61fa6f69689496/Manual/Tactics/Coersions.lean#L21

For the record: I looked through the tactic list and have a list of (not large, but they will hopefully help significantly) changes I'd like to make to the tactic categorisation and selection. I'll be at a conference this week; feel free to bug me about this if you'd like to change something yourself/want to coordinate or discuss.

Yes please PR, or Im also happy if people get added to the repo and push directly. I think maintainers do have these rights automatically, others might need to ask first.

I threw this together in one evening and I'd be happy if people helped getting it into shape :)
leanprover-community.github.io#591 adds a link for this to the community website.

also, if a maintainer could add the website link ( https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib-manual/html-multi/ ) to the repo that would be appreciated. (looks like I don't have the right permissions to do so)
